title: ASH volleyball sweeps WCA
text:
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GRAND COTEAU – The Academy of The Sacred Heart volleyball team underwent a transformation this weekend in New Orleans and on Tuesday night the Saints returned to the home court and showed what they learned. 
That improvement was evident throughout three sets as the Saints remained undefeated in district with a 3-0 victory over Westminster Christian Academy. 
“We played against some tough competition (in New Orleans) and I thought we had a carry over from that (against Westminster). 
“Our hitting, blocking and defense all looked better because of the competition we played in the (New Orleans) tournament. 
“I think our girls used that experience this week and really showed they have stepped it up,” said ASH head volleyball coach Megan McCown. 
ASH (15-11, 3-0) breezed through the first two sets with consecutive 25-9 wins. 
In the third game Westminster (17-10, 1-1) rushed to a 12-1 advantage before the Saints tied it at 23 and afterward won three of the next four points to finish the match with a 26-24 victory. 
WCA head volleyball coach Kim Barber said her team didn’t play well. 
“Yes, they (WCA) were intimidated. We have some young players and it showed at times. That’s no excuse, because overall we had too many hitting errors,” said Barber. 
Westminster’s attacking game was led by Erin Mockler (18 kills) and Maci Quebedeaux (29 assists and four kills). 
Miller Ezell provided eight digs, while Mary Virginia Guice supplied seven. 
Stacia Newton had six kills for the Crusaders, while Blythe Thompson and Neilee Newton had three each. Ivy Cains had two (kills). 
Ezell served the Saints to an 11-0 advantage in the first set as the Crusaders committed seven hitting errors and Mockler had two kills. 
Stacia Newton helped WCA back into the game with a pair of kills that helped the Crusaders to 16-7 , Another three Mockler kills finished the set. 
It was a similar script in the second set. 
Mockler and Quebedeaux combined for five kills as the Saints moved in front 13-3. 
Neilee Newton and Stacia Newton collectively had three kills as the Crusaders closed to 15-6. 
Hannah Jumonville served the Saints’ final five points. 
WCA took a 12-1 lead in the third game with Hannah Fontenot serving. 
Stacia Newton blocked three shots and Neilee Newton had two kills during the Crusaders’ initial run. 
ASH benefitted mainly from numerous unearned points and cut the lead to 14-10 on a Mockler service ace. 
The Saints tied it at 17 on a Mockler kill, but WCA remained in front (23-20) on a pair of Stacia Newton aces. 
ASH didn’t take the lead until it was 24-23 as WCA had a hitting error. 
McCown said she wasn’t worried about her team during the third set. 
“We won the first two on single digits during the first two. I knew our kids would come back, because we are playing with confidence right now,” she said. Read or Share this story: http://www.dailyworld.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/13/ash-volleyball-sweeps-wca/73903774/ TOP VIDEOS
